11#ifndef VPX_VPX_VPX_EXT_RATECTRL_H_
12#define VPX_VPX_VPX_EXT_RATECTRL_H_
13
14#ifdef __cplusplus
15extern "C" {
16#endif
17
18#include "./vpx_integer.h"
19
20/*!\brief Current ABI version number
21 *
22 * \internal
23 * If this file is altered in any way that changes the ABI, this value
24 * must be bumped. Examples include, but are not limited to, changing
25 * types, removing or reassigning enums, adding/removing/rearranging
26 * fields to structures.
27 */
28#define VPX_EXT_RATECTRL_ABI_VERSION (1)
29
30/*!\brief Abstract rate control model handler
31 *
32 * The encoder will receive the model handler from create_model() defined in
33 * vpx_rc_funcs_t.
34 */
35typedef void *vpx_rc_model_t;
36
37/*!\brief Encode frame decision made by the external rate control model
38 *
39 * The encoder will receive the decision from the external rate control model
40 * through get_encodeframe_decision() defined in vpx_rc_funcs_t.
41 */
42typedef struct vpx_rc_encodeframe_decision {
43 int q_index; /**< Quantizer step index [0..255]*/
44} vpx_rc_encodeframe_decision_t;
45
46/*!\brief Information for the frame to be encoded.
47 *
48 * The encoder will send the information to external rate control model through
49 * get_encodeframe_decision() defined in vpx_rc_funcs_t.
50 *
51 */
52typedef struct vpx_rc_encodeframe_info {
53 /*!
54 * 0: Key frame
55 * 1: Inter frame
56 * 2: Alternate reference frame
57 * 3: Overlay frame
58 * 4: Golden frame
59 */
60 int frame_type;
61 int show_index; /**< display index, starts from zero*/
62 int coding_index; /**< coding index, starts from zero*/
63 /*!
64 * index in group of picture, starts from zero.
65 */
66 int gop_index;
67 int ref_frame_coding_indexes[3]; /**< three reference frames' coding indices*/
68 /*!
69 * The validity of the three reference frames.
70 * 0: Invalid
71 * 1: Valid
72 */
73 int ref_frame_valid_list[3];
74} vpx_rc_encodeframe_info_t;
75
76/*!\brief Frame coding result
77 *
78 * The encoder will send the result to the external rate control model through
79 * update_encodeframe_result() defined in vpx_rc_funcs_t.
80 */
81typedef struct vpx_rc_encodeframe_result {
82 int64_t sse; /**< sum of squared error of the reconstructed frame */
83 int64_t bit_count; /**< number of bits spent on coding the frame*/
84 int64_t pixel_count; /**< number of pixels in YUV planes of the frame*/
85} vpx_rc_encodeframe_result_t;
86
87/*!\brief Status returned by rate control callback functions.
88 */
89typedef enum vpx_rc_status {
90 VPX_RC_OK = 0,
91 VPX_RC_ERROR = 1,
92} vpx_rc_status_t;
93
94/*!\brief First pass frame stats
95 * This is a mirror of vp9's FIRSTPASS_STATS except that spatial_layer_id is
96 * omitted
97 */
98typedef struct vpx_rc_frame_stats {
99 /*!
100 * Frame number in display order, if stats are for a single frame.
101 * No real meaning for a collection of frames.
102 */
103 double frame;
104 /*!
105 * Weight assigned to this frame (or total weight for the collection of
106 * frames) currently based on intra factor and brightness factor. This is used
107 * to distribute bits between easier and harder frames.
108 */
109 double weight;
110 /*!
111 * Intra prediction error.
112 */
113 double intra_error;
114 /*!
115 * Best of intra pred error and inter pred error using last frame as ref.
116 */
117 double coded_error;
118 /*!
119 * Best of intra pred error and inter pred error using golden frame as ref.
120 */
121 double sr_coded_error;
122 /*!
123 * Estimate the noise energy of the current frame.
124 */
125 double frame_noise_energy;
126 /*!
127 * Percentage of blocks with inter pred error < intra pred error.
128 */
129 double pcnt_inter;
130 /*!
131 * Percentage of blocks using (inter prediction and) non-zero motion vectors.
132 */
133 double pcnt_motion;
134 /*!
135 * Percentage of blocks where golden frame was better than last or intra:
136 * inter pred error using golden frame < inter pred error using last frame and
137 * inter pred error using golden frame < intra pred error
138 */
139 double pcnt_second_ref;
140 /*!
141 * Percentage of blocks where intra and inter prediction errors were very
142 * close.
143 */
144 double pcnt_neutral;
145 /*!
146 * Percentage of blocks that have intra error < inter error and inter error <
147 * LOW_I_THRESH
148 * - bit_depth 8: LOW_I_THRESH = 24000
149 * - bit_depth 10: LOW_I_THRESH = 24000 << 4
150 * - bit_depth 12: LOW_I_THRESH = 24000 << 8
151 */
152 double pcnt_intra_low;
153 /*!
154 * Percentage of blocks that have intra error < inter error and intra error <
155 * LOW_I_THRESH but inter error >= LOW_I_THRESH LOW_I_THRESH
156 * - bit_depth 8: LOW_I_THRESH = 24000
157 * - bit_depth 10: LOW_I_THRESH = 24000 << 4
158 * - bit_depth 12: LOW_I_THRESH = 24000 << 8
159 */
160 double pcnt_intra_high;
161 /*!
162 * Percentage of blocks that have almost no intra error residual
163 * (i.e. are in effect completely flat and untextured in the intra
164 * domain). In natural videos this is uncommon, but it is much more
165 * common in animations, graphics and screen content, so may be used
166 * as a signal to detect these types of content.
167 */
168 double intra_skip_pct;
169 /*!
170 * Percentage of blocks that have intra error < SMOOTH_INTRA_THRESH
171 * - bit_depth 8: SMOOTH_INTRA_THRESH = 4000
172 * - bit_depth 10: SMOOTH_INTRA_THRESH = 4000 << 4
173 * - bit_depth 12: SMOOTH_INTRA_THRESH = 4000 << 8
174 */
175 double intra_smooth_pct;
176 /*!
177 * Image mask rows top and bottom.
178 */
179 double inactive_zone_rows;
180 /*!
181 * Image mask columns at left and right edges.
182 */
183 double inactive_zone_cols;
184 /*!
185 * Mean of row motion vectors.
186 */
187 double MVr;
188 /*!
189 * Mean of absolute value of row motion vectors.
190 */
191 double mvr_abs;
192 /*!
193 * Mean of column motion vectors.
194 */
195 double MVc;
196 /*!
197 * Mean of absolute value of column motion vectors.
198 */
199 double mvc_abs;
200 /*!
201 * Variance of row motion vectors.
202 */
203 double MVrv;
204 /*!
205 * Variance of column motion vectors.
206 */
207 double MVcv;
208 /*!
209 * Value in range [-1,1] indicating fraction of row and column motion vectors
210 * that point inwards (negative MV value) or outwards (positive MV value).
211 * For example, value of 1 indicates, all row/column MVs are inwards.
212 */
213 double mv_in_out_count;
214 /*!
215 * Duration of the frame / collection of frames.
216 */
217 double duration;
218 /*!
219 * 1.0 if stats are for a single frame, or
220 * number of frames whose stats are accumulated.
221 */
222 double count;
223} vpx_rc_frame_stats_t;
224
225/*!\brief Collection of first pass frame stats
226 */
227typedef struct vpx_rc_firstpass_stats {
228 /*!
229 * Pointer to first pass frame stats.
230 * The pointed array of vpx_rc_frame_stats_t should have length equal to
231 * number of show frames in the video.
232 */
233 vpx_rc_frame_stats_t *frame_stats;
234 /*!
235 * Number of show frames in the video.
236 */
237 int num_frames;
238} vpx_rc_firstpass_stats_t;
239
240/*!\brief Encode config sent to external rate control model
241 */
242typedef struct vpx_rc_config {
243 int frame_width; /**< frame width */
244 int frame_height; /**< frame height */
245 int show_frame_count; /**< number of visible frames in the video */
246 /*!
247 * Target bitrate in kilobytes per second
248 */
249 int target_bitrate_kbps;
250 int frame_rate_num; /**< numerator of frame rate */
251 int frame_rate_den; /**< denominator of frame rate */
252} vpx_rc_config_t;
253
254/*!\brief Create an external rate control model callback prototype
255 *
256 * This callback is invoked by the encoder to create an external rate control
257 * model.
258 *
259 * \param[in] priv Callback's private data
260 * \param[in] ratectrl_config Pointer to vpx_rc_config_t
261 * \param[out] rate_ctrl_model_pt Pointer to vpx_rc_model_t
262 */
263typedef vpx_rc_status_t (*vpx_rc_create_model_cb_fn_t)(
264 void *priv, const vpx_rc_config_t *ratectrl_config,
265 vpx_rc_model_t *rate_ctrl_model_pt);
266
267/*!\brief Send first pass stats to the external rate control model callback
268 * prototype
269 *
270 * This callback is invoked by the encoder to send first pass stats to the
271 * external rate control model.
272 *
273 * \param[in] rate_ctrl_model rate control model
274 * \param[in] first_pass_stats first pass stats
275 */
276typedef vpx_rc_status_t (*vpx_rc_send_firstpass_stats_cb_fn_t)(
277 vpx_rc_model_t rate_ctrl_model,
278 const vpx_rc_firstpass_stats_t *first_pass_stats);
279
280/*!\brief Receive encode frame decision callback prototype
281 *
282 * This callback is invoked by the encoder to receive encode frame decision from
283 * the external rate control model.
284 *
285 * \param[in] rate_ctrl_model rate control model
286 * \param[in] encode_frame_info information of the coding frame
287 * \param[out] frame_decision encode decision of the coding frame
288 */
289typedef vpx_rc_status_t (*vpx_rc_get_encodeframe_decision_cb_fn_t)(
290 vpx_rc_model_t rate_ctrl_model,
291 const vpx_rc_encodeframe_info_t *encode_frame_info,
292 vpx_rc_encodeframe_decision_t *frame_decision);
293
294/*!\brief Update encode frame result callback prototype
295 *
296 * This callback is invoked by the encoder to update encode frame result to the
297 * external rate control model.
298 *
299 * \param[in] rate_ctrl_model rate control model
300 * \param[out] encode_frame_result encode result of the coding frame
301 */
302typedef vpx_rc_status_t (*vpx_rc_update_encodeframe_result_cb_fn_t)(
303 vpx_rc_model_t rate_ctrl_model,
304 const vpx_rc_encodeframe_result_t *encode_frame_result);
305
306/*!\brief Delete the external rate control model callback prototype
307 *
308 * This callback is invoked by the encoder to delete the external rate control
309 * model.
310 *
311 * \param[in] rate_ctrl_model rate control model
312 */
313typedef vpx_rc_status_t (*vpx_rc_delete_model_cb_fn_t)(
314 vpx_rc_model_t rate_ctrl_model);
315
316/*!\brief Callback function set for external rate control.
317 *
318 * The user can enable external rate control by registering
319 * a set of callback functions with the codec control flag
320 * VP9E_SET_EXTERNAL_RATE_CONTROL.
321 */
322typedef struct vpx_rc_funcs {
323 /*!
324 * Create an external rate control model.
325 */
326 vpx_rc_create_model_cb_fn_t create_model;
327 /*!
328 * Send first pass stats to the external rate control model.
329 */
330 vpx_rc_send_firstpass_stats_cb_fn_t send_firstpass_stats;
331 /*!
332 * Get encodeframe decision from the external rate control model.
333 */
334 vpx_rc_get_encodeframe_decision_cb_fn_t get_encodeframe_decision;
335 /*!
336 * Update encodeframe result to the external rate control model.
337 */
338 vpx_rc_update_encodeframe_result_cb_fn_t update_encodeframe_result;
339 /*!
340 * Delete the external rate control model.
341 */
342 vpx_rc_delete_model_cb_fn_t delete_model;
343 /*!
344 * Private data for the external rate control model.
345 */
346 void *priv;
347} vpx_rc_funcs_t;
348
349#ifdef __cplusplus
350} // extern "C"
351#endif
352
353#endif // VPX_VPX_VPX_EXT_RATECTRL_H_
354
